sections.heading: S2. Ep18. Talking with Charles Hammersla about managing large portfolio's of properties, and all things Facilities Management

sections.content: In this podcast episode, we talk with +[Charles Hammersla](https://www.linkedin.com/in/charles-hammersla-36958211/)+, who heads up the Facilities Management team at +[Cushman & Wakefield](https://www.cushmanwakefield.com/en/australia)+, overseeing in excess of 600 properties across Australia, on behalf of the +[National Australia Bank (NAB)](https://www.nab.com.au/)+.
Charles is the Facilities Management Association (FMA), Facilities Manager of the year for 2021! So who better to speak with about Facilities Management?!?

We covered a wide variety of topics, from how he got into FM, the role of a Facilities Manager, developing the process that delivers defects-free projects, the variety of works required of an FMâ€¦..and much more, including:

items: His background in Law and stepping into building compliance, then FM
The broad nature of the FM industry
Work space and work spaces of the future
Successfully managing a portfolio with around 650 properties
Capturing building data to better manage a Property Asset.

sections.content: If you have an interest in the built environment, managing property, and a better understanding of how we can deliver projects and manage buildings and the services within those buildings, then have a listen.
